title: Features
content:
“Sound game training” app is an app for practicing sound games.
You can check the notes by playing back the video, and you can also pseudo-play by touching on the video.
Adding a Playback Video There are two ways to add videos to be played in the app.
In-device or Google Drive Play videos in the device or on Google Drive.
Here’s how you can add them in this app.
 Open the “Video List” screen Click on the “+” button at the bottom right of the screen Select “In Device + Google Drive” from the list of alternatives Select the video you want to add Enter your registration information and click the “Add” button  After this step, you can return to the “Video List” screen and your added videos will be in the list.
Play YouTube video YouTube is a video sharing service from Google. Videos of sound games uploaded by others exist.
Here’s how you can add them in this app.
 Open the “Video List” screen Click on the “+” button at the bottom right of the screen Select “YouTube” from the list of alternatives Open the video page you want to add from the YouTube site Click the “Add video” button at the bottom right of the video page Enter your registration information and click the “Add” button  After this step, you can return to the “Video List” screen and your added videos will be in the list.
Since the app does not download YouTube videos, a traffic volume is generated every time a video is played on this app.
 Pseudo-play You won’t be paused by tapping on the playing video screen.
So you can play a pseudo sound game.
There are many other features that make it easier to practice.
 Adjust the video playback speed
You can adjust the playback speed in the range of 0.25-2.00x speed Adjust the start/end position of video playback
You can set the start and end of the play range to focus on the difficult parts of the game Zoom in/out and adjust the position of the video
Scaling and positioning can be done to make the video fit the device resolution   Support for both portrait and landscape video
You can fix your device orientation in portrait or landscape mode Shortcut button to rewind/fast-forward for a few seconds during playback
The shortcut button is set up so that you can easily manipulate the time without having to pause and operate the seek bar  Play at low double speed  It has the ability to reduce the playback speed of videos.
"The chart is too fast for me to understand!" Try playing at 0.25x speed and gradually increase the speed by 0.05x.
Try to figure out the score at low double speed and gradually increase the speed while playing pseudo-playing.
Bookmark the playback position  There is a function to register the start/end position of video playback as a bookmark.
By setting the start/end position of playback for each number, you can quickly switch the playback position for the part you want to practice.
Enlarge/reduce video, move position  Pinch in/out to zoom in/out, swipe to move position.
You can import screenshots of games into the application. Adjust the transparency of the image as you see it. Adjusting audio delay  If the video and audio are out of sync, the audio delay can be adjusted in increments of 0.01 seconds.
Please adjust if the video itself has audio delay or if you are using Bluetooth earphones with audio delay.

title: FAQ
content:
Video    Q. Do you think I can practice music games with an app that just plays videos?   You can do the following things to improve your practice.
‚óè No pausing by tapping the screen during playback
‚óè You can set the playback range
‚óè You can adjust the playback speed
‚óè Video expansion, contraction and movement is possible
Just tapping the screen while playing the part you're weak in is good enough practice üí™
So start practicing today ‚ô™~        Q. Can I orient it vertically?   "Video Selection" You can change the orientation by tapping the "Device is rotating" icon in the right upper corner of the screen.        Q. Can you display touch?   You can't do it with this app.
In the device's Settings app, go to Developer Options and turn on "Show Taps".        Q. Is it possible to make a touch sound?   Settings can be made from "Common settings  Touch on video  Touch sound" from the upper right of the video list screen.
There are various kinds of touch sounds, so please choose the one you like ‚ô™~       Q. Is it possible to show the touch points?   You can set the display settings for touch from "Settings  Settings on Video  Point" in the app.
You can also set the color and display size, so you can adjust it to your liking ‚ô™~        Q. Can I adjust the volume of the touch sound?   Settings can be made from "Common settings  Touch on video  Volume" from the upper right of the video list screen.        Q. I'm having trouble with the tap position and pause button being in the same place in some play videos. Can you fix this problem?   You can change the pause button to a long tap.
The button is changed by selecting "Folder Settings  Pause Button" from the upper right button on the video list screen, and then selecting long tap ‚ô™~        Q. Can you fix audio delay?   The audio delay can be adjusted in 0.01 second increments from the video screen.
Please see the separate page for details.        Q. Is there a function to fast forward/rewind for a few seconds?   Yes, you can. You can set it from "Folder settings  Fast Forward/Rewind button" from the upper right button on the video list screen.
You can also specify the number of seconds, so try adjusting it ‚ô™~        Q. Can I reposition or hide the rewind/fast forward button?   The position cannot be changed, but it can be hidden.
You can set it from "Folder settings  Fast Forward/Rewind button" from the upper right button on the video list screen.       Q. The resolution of YouTube videos is low. Is it possible for me to change it?   You can choose from 240p/360p/720p. The default setting is 360p.
You can configure the settings from "Common Settings  Video traffic" at the bottom left of the video list screen.     --    Q. Can I delete videos from my device or GoogleDrive after adding a video?   If deleted, the video will no longer play in the application.
This application only reads videos from external sources.        Q. Can I increase the FPS of the video?   This is possible if the FPS of the video is high, the FPS limit of the device is also high, and the device is Android 12 or higher.
Please change it from "Common Settings  Video  fps Limit" from the upper right corner of the video list screen.     Requests/bugs    Q. Where do I make my request?   Please send us your request from "Contact" in the app. We can't accept all requests, but we will consider them.
Sometimes Google Play reviews fail to capture the intent and are sent off, so we recommend that you communicate at the feedback site.        Q. Where do I report bugs?   Please send us your request from "Contact" in the app. We can't accept all requests, but we will consider them.
Sometimes Google Play reviews fail to capture the intent and are sent off, so we recommend that you communicate at the feedback site.        Q. YouTube videos are no longer playing in the app. Is this a bug?   It's most likely a bug. Please contact us from "Feedback" in the upper right corner of the video list screen in the application, including the URL of the video that does not play.       Q. Videos from my camera roll are no longer playing in the app. Is this a bug?   Deleting a video from the camera roll will stop it from playing.
If you choose to save photos to iCloud, they will not be playable at a later date. Please register the video uploaded to iCloud to the application.
If you have videos in your camera roll but they do not play, try restarting the app/device to see if that solves the problem.     -- Other    Q. Can't I get rid of ads through in-app purchases?   You can remove ads by becoming a supporter.
For more information, please tap the "Ad" button in the upper right corner of the video list screen.        Q. Do you accept Donate?   I accept from the tip link in the menu on the upper left.
